review.summary: Simple __init__.py module file that properly exposes the RedisEventProcessor class through explicit __all__ definition. This is a standard Python package initialization file with minimal but correct implementation. The file follows neo-commons conventions for public API control through comprehensive __all__ lists.

positive_observations.observation: Uses comprehensive __all__ list for explicit public API control following neo-commons patterns
Proper relative import pattern for infrastructure components
Clear and concise module docstring explaining purpose
Follows single responsibility principle - only exposes event processors
Minimal surface area with no unnecessary complexity

context.tests: No tests needed for simple __init__.py file - tested through integration with RedisEventProcessor
context.configuration: No configuration required for this init file
